explanation: [0-0] A woman in a white coat and black apron stands behind a large pot. Black sugar pearls are cooking in the pot. She holds a long spoon in one hand and rests the other hand on a white paper cup. Beside her is a stack of white cups. The background reveals a room cluttered with various items, including a white machine, where two individuals in white attire are busy working, along with several passersby.

[0-7] The woman scoops out a spoonful of pearls, pours them into a cup, and sets it aside. The scene shifts to a man wearing black gloves kneading dough on a cutting board. Beside him is a large round plate. The table is yellow, accompanied by a black machine and a wooden mallet. In the background, a transparent glass door reveals more items stacked outside. The man kneads the dough twice more, flattens it with a mallet, and then rolls it out with a rolling pin.

[7-16] Next, he uses a white tool to cut off a portion of the dough and feeds it into the machine. A close-up of the machine shows small black balls rolling out of it and dropping into the plate below. The man dusts each pearl with flour by hand. The scene cuts to the man pouring a bucket of cooked pearls into a large pot. The camera returns to the woman from the beginning, scooping pearls, and then repeats the sequence from a first-person perspective.
